title: US Infrastructure Has A D+ Rating
teaser: Last week’s Amtrak tragedy has reignited a debate over U.S. infrastructure spending. According to the latest American Society of Civil Engineers Report card-- U.S. Infrastructure’s Grade Point Average is at a D-Plus. The 2013 Report Card shows we have a significant backlog of overdue maintenance across our infrastructure systems, a pressing need for modernization, and a great opportunity to create reliable, long-term funding. Kathleen speaks with a representative of ASCE about the report card and what is needed.
